subject: Why havent altcoins pumped in 5 years?
gestalt_summary: METANARRATIVE: The thread reveals a deep disillusionment among altcoin investors on /biz/, who perceive altseasons as either dead, fraudulent, or a relic of a bygone, unregulated era. The sentiment reflects exhaustion and despair over underperforming speculative assets, with a growing consensus that the crypto market has matured, favoring Bitcoin as a long-term investment akin to traditional assets, over risky altcoin gambles.
top_quote: Crypto has been easily accessible to the public for years now through exchanges and even normie apps like robinhood. Anyone interested has already bought, the frontier days are over. Third worlders will slowly buy into crypto as they get internet access, so we can expect a upward trend over time in bitcoin even after crash cycles. But the situation is similar to computer hardware, when the tech was new there was tons of diversity in products. The first consumers were discerning and picked their products based off a long checklist because they were auteurs of their hobby. Soon after as it became more mainstream the public settled mostly on Apple and Microsoft systems. There were guys back then at the time who thought the same as you, "The new Commodore Amiga will surely make a breakthrough in the market with how advanced it is compared to the other products!". And then nothing happened because 95% of the consumers were normies who didn't care and couldn't be swayed from their already help preferences. Stop hoping for a 10x in some altcoin, it's not going to happen. Buy and hold bitcoin like boomers do the S&P 500 and in 30 years you'll be fine. If that's not fast enough then rugpull some indians or something. Find a new investment other than crypto maybe, idk. But you gotta be able to recognize when the party is over if you're gonna invest in anything.
